subject: DOS games
Vintage computer games
Educational games
items.description: The aim of the game is to consume as many correctly spelled words as possible.  To do so it is necessary to eat the letters that make up each word in the correct sequence.  Points are awarded for each letter eaten in the correct sequence and deducted for each letter eaten out of sequence.        The game has some inbuilt hazards and rewards and can be played at 4 levels of difficulty.  Masters of level 4 may be ready for "Codeworm".                                            WORDWORM is based upon the recognition that not all words lend themselves to neat rules of spelling.  Such words are largely mastered by repetition and recognition of what the correctly spelled word looks like.  WORDWORM uses a basic dictionary of frequently misspelt words and a game strategy that reinforces the correct spelling of these words.  You can add particular words that your child or student finds troublesome to this basic dictionary or create your own separate dictionary.
items.title: Wordworm

items.description: World Championship Boxing Manager (1990)(Goliath Games)[m3] Also For Acorn 32-bit, Amiga, Atari ST, Commodore 64, DOS, ZX Spectrum Released 1990 Published by Goliath Games Developed by Goliath Games Genre Simulation, Sports Sport Boxing Gameplay Managerial / Business Simulation Description In World Championship Boxing Manager the player can develop the careers of aspiring heavyweight boxers. The option are selected through an icon-based system, representing the manager's office. Training the boxers involves deciding which areas they should work on, considering their strengths and weaknesses and any damage inflicted in previous fights, and those of their next opponent. There are 97 of these in the game, so reaching the top of the rankings will take about 15-20 fights. Choosing a beatable opponent who can get the fight as high up the Friday Night bill as possible, as well as negotiating the best financial deal and a mutually agreeable dare, are the main considerations. Two different governing bodies are included in the game, each with subtly different rules. A fight in one set of rules won't be viewed quite as significantly by the other. The matches are presented from the commentary box, with the two expert analysts exchanging textual descriptions of the key punches, and who is dong the best (a clue to how any judges’ decision would go). Before and during the fights the player can instruct the boxer as to what tactics to adopt. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry
items.title: World Championship Boxing Manager (1990)(Goliath Games)[m3]

items.description: World Championship Soccer (1990)(Elite Systems)[cr GPA] Also For Amiga, Arcade, Atari ST, Commodore 64, DOS, Genesis, SEGA Master System, ZX Spectrum Released 1990 Published by Elite Systems Ltd. Developed by SEGA Enterprises Ltd. Genre Sports Sport Football (European) / Soccer Interface Direct Control, Multiple Units/Characters Control Perspective Top-down Description This soccer game lets you choose a team representing one of twenty-four countries around the world to participate in the World Championship tournament, which is identical to the real 1990 World Cup. Once you pick your team you can also select which players you want on the field, so that you can round out the team's strengths and weaknesses. Also provided are modes for single exhibition matches, either against the computer or against a friend. The action is viewed from above with large player sprites. Violent play is encouraged as there are no free kicks. The gameplay is rather simple: you can only control the player closest to the ball, and many soccer rules (such as penalty flags and offsides) are missing. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry
items.title: World Championship Soccer (1990)(Elite Systems)[cr GPA]

items.description: X Out (1990)(Rainbow Arts)[cr Reilan][t Reilan] Also For Amiga, Atari ST, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum Released 1990 Published by Rainbow Arts Software GmbH Developed by Rainbow Arts Software GmbH Genre Action Setting Sci-Fi / Futuristic Gameplay Arcade, Shooter Visual 2D scrolling Perspective Side view Description X-Out is a horizontally scrolling shoot-'em-up. Unlike most comparable games (e.g. R-Type ), the game is not set in outer space or even in the air - instead, the fight between good and evil is underwater. Through five levels, the player has to shoot countless enemies, complete with the obligatory mid-level and end-level bosses. After having completed a level, the player gets to purchase new weapons; instead of simply buying upgrades, it is possible to customize the ship by placing new weapons anywhere on it. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry

subject: DOS games
Vintage computer games
Action games
items.description: XAPTRON is mind-bogglingly simple. Stuff shoots at you. You shoot back. It's hard to get simpler than that. If I was in the right kind of mood, I'd write some sort of science-fiction flak whereby the little things that shoot at you are called "drones" or "seekers" or something ("Srones?" "Deekers?") and you're in a warp-drive spaceship bound for Planet Xandar to depose the evil Star Emperor Mungle the Snootful, but that's not the kind of mood I'm in. Never mind. I've always felt that games which required that much background material to set the mood weren't worth the trouble it took to start 'em up. How much purple prose do you need before you're in a mood to shoot something? I'm in that mood right now.
items.title: XAPTRON

items.description: Jim Norton demonstrates Augment support of complex project collaborations and resulting repositories, aka "handbooks" (a Doug Engelbart term for 'what is the current picture of the dynamically evolving knowledge that a team is needing to operate on' see DKR for more detail). Jim joined Doug's research team in the late 1960s and later went on to manage the Augment group at Tymshare, Inc.  Produced: August 14, 1990 (before internet)

items.description: Patricia Cruz, then Deputy Director for Programs at the Studio Museum in Harlem, describes the political climate for performance art at the time of the Decade Show Performance Series. Her comments refer to the National Endowment for the Arts denying funding to the NEA Four: Karen Finley, Tom MIller, John Fleck, and Holly Hughes. Cruz encourages the audience to contact their government and advocate for freedom of expression and performance art. "The Decade Show: Frameworks of Identity in the 1980s," an exhibition co-organized by the New Museum, the Museum of Contemporary Hispanic Art, and the Studio Museum in Harlem. The performance was presented at the Dance Theater Workshop, Bessie Schonberg Theater.
items.title: The Decade Show Performance Series: Call to Action from Patricia Cruz

items.description: Videodance with the Laziza Electrique Dance Company. Somnabulant Four dancers move in a metaphoric environment with kaleidoscopic mix. The dance progresses through variations in the imagery as the kaleidoscope moves between different reflection symmetries. Reality is interspersed with hyper-reality of reflection and dreams to reveal relationships within the sleepwalking state.
items.title: Somnambulent

items.description: Waterbug Waterlily with Genevieve Lam and Teresa Adams, the two dancers shift perceptive and focus and explore relationships between a mover and a seer. The mover rows through space with a long staff and the seer peers through space which is modulated by various mediums. The action moves between light and darkness and the camera explores what can be seen as it views the dancers through lenses and rippling water. Waterbug Waterlily received the Dance on Camera Honorable Mention.
items.title: Waterbug Waterlily

items.description: Metamorphosis is a tribute to American dance icon Loie Fuller. The dancer's immense skirt provides a flexible screen that modulates projected videoart images by the Laziza Videodance and Lumia Project. Then the mood shifts to a freer dance as the dress is shed. In the end we are taken back to the beginning with a star image showing directly on the torso of the dancer. This Videodance features dancer Judy Marriott (Fowler).
items.title: Metamorphosis

items.description: Black and white S8 silent footage. Scifi film about a scientist working on memory who forgets where his house is. This is relatively early in the film, after his first discovery his house is lost. Things will go downhill from here. Some interesting shots of ext. modern buildings and interior laboratory buildings, as well as rats. Some aerials and map shots of Atlanta.
items.title: Angst Angstrom Anguish_Reel04

items.description: Black and white S8 silent footage. Scifi film about a scientist working on memory who forgets where his house is and drives through increasingly decaying areas in search of it. This is his second attempt to find his house, in a planned community. Some dialogue of characters in labs. B roll of pills, factory/steam plant interiors, roller coaster & other amusement park ride machinery - tilt a whirls, flying planes, etc.
items.title: Angst Angstrom Anguish_Reel05_Part1

items.description: Scifi film about a scientist working on memory who forgets where his house is and drives through increasingly decaying areas in search of it. In this reel, he drives past bungalow houses circa 1950-75. Some washed out footage of abandoned buildings; drivebys of historic Cabbagetown, a mill community in Atlanta.
items.title: Angst Angstrom Anguish Reel 05_Pt2

items.description: Black and white S8 silent footage. Scifi film about a scientist working on memory who forgets where his house is and drives through increasingly decaying areas in search of it. In this tape, he goes to see his sinister boss who threatens his project with cancellation, has fraught interactions with his assistant as his rats fail to run a memory maze, and has a staredown with a rat.
items.title: Angst Angstrom Anguish Reel 07

items.description: Black and white S8 silent footage. Scifi film about a scientist working on memory who forgets where his house is and drives through increasingly decaying areas in search of it. Here, he has lost his house, is sleeping in his lab, and his experiments are failing. Most of the footage is in the interior of his lab, featuring fights with his assistant and increasing angst.
items.title: Angst Angstrom Anguish_Reel08

items.description: Black and white S8 silent footage. Scifi film about a scientist working on memory who forgets where his house is and drives through increasingly decaying areas in search of it. Here, he has lost his house, is sleeping in his lab, and his experiments are failing. He drinks his experimental memory solution and drives off through decrepit areas of Atlanta in search of his house. Things don't go well.
items.title: Angst Angstrom Anguish_Reel09

items.description: Black and white S8 silent footage. Scifi film about a scientist working on memory who forgets where his house is and drives through increasingly decaying areas in search of it. Here, he is on his final quest for his house. Features driving broll of trainyards, factories, and junkyards.
items.title: Angst Angstrom Anguish_Reel10

items.description: One of the most important television shows in history, "The Show With No Name" was a weekly cable access program broadcast from Austin, Texas. Featuring public submissions of 'clips,' interspersed with the commentary of hosts Charlie Sotelo and Cinco, "The Show with No Name" not only spoke truth to power for the Supreme Court's historic ruling in Sony Corp. of America v. Universal City Studios, Inc. 464 U.S. 417 (1984), while articulating the wealth of challenges within the field of video preservation, but more importantly it forecast an entire generation's paradigm for watching moving images. This transfer was made from a videotape compilation, amalgamated from Rankin's collection of 8-hour off-air tapes. James Brown on "Sonya" Crispin Glover on "Late Night With David Letterman" "Winnebago Guy" "Coming to America" by All the King's Men "Rejected" by Don Hertzfeld "Woman Crushes Cans With Tits" "Costa Rica, Or Bust" "Jackass" Pilot Outtakes Beastie Boys on "The Scott and Gary Show" "Cocaine Cowboy" "Dancing Outlaw" David Bowie and Iggy Pop on "DINAH!" Clips from "Eat the Document" The Rolling Stones on "The Ed Sullivan Show" "Jon Doe Hippy Show" Labor Day Special #2 Muhammad Ali vs. Antonio Inoki Brother Theodor on "Late Night with David Letterman" Johnny Carson on "Late Night with David Letterman" clips "Who Wants to be a Woman?" "The Show With No Name" Intro
items.title: The Show With No Name" Compilation

items.description: Exhumed" was dedicated to my daughter Jacqueline Corianne Shearer, who passed away from a transfusion of HIV/AIDS. "Dr. Sue's Phone Call" A conversation with Dr. Sue Shapiro. "Mom, Dad and Baby" Animated short about being a family and then not. Created on an Amiga Toaster. All works edited at NYU's Interactive Telecommunications Program. while I was an artist in residence there.
items.title: Exhumed/Dr. Sue's Phone Call/om DadBaby Death Cartoon

items.subject: المركز العالمي لدراسات و ابحاث الكتاب الاخضر
items.description: محاضرة قائد ثورة الفاتح العالمية في طلبة العلوم السياسية بجامعة ناصر الأممية 14 من جمادى الآخرة 1399 و.ر/ 11 من شهر أي النار (يناير) 1990م معمر القذافي الطبعة الأولى منشورات المركز العالمي لدراسات و أبحاث الكتاب الأخضر الشركة العامة للورق و الطباعة مطابع الثورة العربية طرابلس المحتويات نبوءات الكتاب الأخضر تتحقق الأجراء سيصبحون شركاء الأرض ملك للجميع قصرنا في نشر النظرية كلمة ديموكراسي تعني الشعب على الكراسي العالم يتجه نحو الجماهيرية التعددية هي المرحلة ما قبل المؤتمرات الشعبية لم نقدم النموذج الجماهيري حتى الآن سويسرا تعد شكلا من اشكال الجماهيرية الشيوعية ..فكرة خيالية ضغطت الجماهير في اتجاه عصرها المانيا الشرقية و المانيا الغربية لماذا الانهيار في أوروبا الشرقية لا تصدقوا الدعاية الغربية رومانيا هي البلد الوحيدة التي سددت ديونها بهرتهم الأشياء البراقة في أوروبا الغربية ما حدث في رومانيا كان صدفة القوى الكبرى لعبت دورا مهما نحن بالفعل في عصر الجماهير الجماهيرية انجاز مهم الكتاب الأخضر في روسيا و بلغاريا لماذا تأخرت الثورة الشعبية في روسيا و بلغاريا لماذا تأخرت الثورة الشعبية في أوروبا الغربية حلقة برلمان و حكومة يجب أن تنتهي لا يعرفون ما يجري في ليبيا السلطة للشعب اللجنة الثورية تساعد الشعب على ممارسة السلطة العالم سيتغير عندما يتم ترجمة الكتاب الأخضر انهيار أوروبا الشرقية ليس عيبا في الماركسية الاشتراكية تعني التشاركيات الاشتراكية لا يمكن ان تنهار من كل حسب جهده و لكل حسب حاجته الموجود في أوروبا الشرقية هو برنامج تقدمي الأغنياء دائما يحكمون في البلاد الرأسمالية سيعود لاوروبا الشرقية صوابها الغرب اصبح غنيا من النهب الاستعماري الثورة الشعبية اطلقنا صرختها من ليبيا سوف تتمزق البلاد المتكونة من عدة قوميات النظرية تسير في طريقها ستقوم المؤتمرات و اللجان الشعبية في كل مكان من العالم يتسولون في بريطانيا

subject: Xapshot
RC-250
Canon
Camera
Photography
items.description: In the era between film and digital cameras, "still video" was a brief interlude. Instead of recording the image digitally, they recorded a single analog frame of video on a small "video floppy". Each image occupied a single track on the floppy. Images were played back through the camera as a video signal, either to a monitor or a video frame grabber on a computer. At the time the Xapshot was introduced (late 1980s) existing digital cameras in a similar price range (less than $1,000) could not capture color, and did not have removable storage for photos, severely limiting their use. By using an analog signal to "compress" the image, Canon was able to sell an electronic camera with re-usable removable media at an affordable price
items.title: Canon Xapshot RC-250 Brochure

Board games
items.description: "The object of Windows Yacht is to reach the highest possible point score by rolling and scoring dice. A game of Yacht consists of thirteen turns, with up to three rolls of the dice allowed for each turn. At the end of each turn a score that has not already been used must be chosen and scored for the current dice. After any of the three rolls of a turn, a score can be chosen for the current dice, ending the turn."

items.description: Remastered version of the SARM Studio Demos 1990 by MP. Only the demos recorded in the SARM Studio were remastered, three tracks weren't. MP has never been a fan of "bonus" tracks that are tacked on: "The live tracks dont really fit, and are probably presented better with the full show that they go with". About the Single Edit of Quartet/Im Alive: "This one is on the recent ABWH re-release in pristine quality (far better sounding then any of my remastering can do)". 1.01 I Would Have Waited Forever #1 (6.58) 1.02 Give And Take (4.21) 1.03 Shock To The System (5.13) 1.04 Take The Water To The Mountain (5.35) 1.05 Holding On (6.50) 1.06 Silent Talking (4.34) 1.07 Untitled (0.46) 1.08 Make Believe (4.57) 1.09 Do'it To Tell (4.22) 1.10 I Would Have Waited Forever #2 (2.15) 1.11 Terms Of Love (Steve Howe Vocal) (1.20) 1.12 After The Storm (3.36) 1.13 Take The Water To The Mountain (4.31) A Kitty Lickin' Discs Production

items.description: Here's a ABWH show that I received in a trade a while back. I haven't seen this show on the tracker since I joined Dime about 6 years ago. Although it's from a soundboard source (possibly ALD), it has some speed problems and dragging - especially at the beginning of the show. I tried to correct the major speed issues, but problems remain. I think the issues start to lessen around the CTTE mark and show sounds really nice from that point on. Also, there are some annoying ticks throughout the show especially noticable between tracks. I'll post samples. Enjoy. Anderson Bruford Wakeman Howe March 4, 1990 (1990-03-04) NHK Hall Shibuya, Tokyo Japan Jon Anderson - Vocals, percussion Steve Howe - Guitars Bill Bruford - Drums Rick Wakeman - Keyboards Tony Levin - Bass Milton McDonald - guitar Julian Colbeck - keyboards 1.01 Young Person's Guide To The Orchestra (0.32) 1.02 Time And A Word - Owner Of A Lonely Heart - Teakbois (7.37) 1.03 The Clap (4.28) 1.04 Mood For A Day (4.43) 1.05 Rick Wakeman Solo (5.00) 1.06 Long Distance Runaraound (dropout at 2:36) (3.27) 1.07 Bill Bruford Solo (3.55) 1.08 Birthright (6.39) 1.09 And You And I (9.22) 1.10 Themes (6.36) 1.11 Bruford - Levin Solo (5.56) 2.01 Close To The Edge (19.50) 2.02 Jon Sings Japanese: Zoh-San (1.42) 2.03 The Meeting (4.39) 2.04 Brother Of Mine (10.40) 2.05 Heart Of The Sunrise (10.27) 2.06 Order Of The Universe (10.29) 2.07 Roundabout (6.06) 2.08 I've Seen All Good People (9.13) Total 2:11:21 Linage: Soundboard > ? > Trade Cassette (John H December 1994) Transfer: Sony TC-WC475 > Sony DTC-ZE700 > E-MU E-DSP Soundcard > 16/48 wav > Wavelab (tracking and tweaking) > you ! whotrader-094-ABWH-1990-03-04

items.description: LDB Special Series #105 Out of my 7,000+ shows and radio broadcasts, I have many concerts that were special for some reasons: the setlist, the musicians, the venue or unexpected events. These are the ones I'd like to propose you. Most of these come from my cassettes collection, so they will be released at a slower pace than my Master Series! But you won't be disappointed! I will try to gather the most unusual things I have in my collection and, as always, your feedback and comments will be my reward for all the work involved in this project. DO NOT share this music on mp3, just convert it for your own use. Sharing mp3's is the right way to make me stop sharing music here. ABWH Yokohama, Bunka Taiikukan March 7, 1990 Soundboard 1.01 Young Person's Guide To The Orchestra ~      Time And A Word ~ Owner Of A Lonely Heart ~ Teakbois (9.30) 1.02 The Clap ~ Mood For A Day (9.52) 1.03 Wakeman Solo (5.18) 1.04 Long Distance Runaround (4.28) 1.05 Bill Bruford Solo (3.22) 1.06 Birthright (6.09) 1.07 And You And I (fades out) (8.03) 1.08 Themes (6.42) 1.09 Levin-Bruford Duet (6.04) 2.01 Close To The Edge (20.35) 2.02 Zoh-San (2.11) 2.03 The Meeting (3.55) 2.04 Brother Of Mine (10.54) 2.05 Heart Of The Sunrise (11.04) 2.06 Order Of The Universe (9.44) 2.07 Roundabout (6.20) 2.08 Starship Trooper (12.49) Lineage: Soundboard > n generation copy > Aiwa Tape Deck AD-WX828 > Audiophile 2496 Soundblaster > HD > SoundForge 8.0 > CD Wave > FLAC Frontend (level 6) Jon Anderson (Vocals) Bill Bruford (Drums) Steve Howe (Guitars) Rick Wakeman (Keyboards) Julian Colbeck (Keyboards) Tony Levin (Bass) Milton McDonald (Guitars) I was transferring this one for my own collection but then I liked the performance so much that I decided to share it. It is a soundboard but it is not a 'pristine' soundboard. Some hiss is present. So I would rate it 9+ at best. Still, this is sounding clear and a full powerful performance from the last leg of the tour. This line-up has always been one of my favourite ever and I am so sorry I had managed to see it just once. I am sure you will love this. ldb

A very good/excellent sounding recording. ABWH are Yes in all but name and the only reason they couldn't use the Yes name was that other members were touring and recording under it at this time. A reconciliation would happen about a year or so after this show resulting in the 8 member version of Yes on the Union album and subsequent tour.

items.title: Yes - ABWH - 1990-03-23 - ABWH - Madison Square Garden - New York City

items.description: Good morning folks....it is a gray, dreary day here in the Northeast US....getting ready to head down to Long Island to see Asia tonight at Westbury, should be interesting..... Time now to conclude my little ABWH series with their final show. I was very sad when they hooked up with Yes West, so for me this tape represents the end of an all-too-short era in Yeshistory. A bit of Yes trivia....Yes once held the record for most sellouts at MSG - 18 - after their sold-out 3 night run in 1980 for the Drama tour. It was interesting to see the photo of the Drama lineup holding up their hockey jerseys with the #18 on the back, as if it was that particular band that had sold out MSG 18 times.... :) Anyway, this tour was a lifetime highlight for me....I saw them 20 times and had way too much fun traveling, meeting cool people and listening to some great music. Hope you all have enjoyed our recordings, there will be a few Masters from the Union tour in the future, including our spectacular Worcester recording....don't know when the transfers will get done, summer is coming and its hard to stay inside, but it will all get out eventually.... Special thanks to Carl for doing such a great job with the transfers, to all my old Yesfriends for making this tour special and especially the musicians for making it all happen in the first place. Thanks also to those who stay on to help seed.... The more generous you are with your music, the more it comes back to you. Without futher delay, I present for your enjoyment: Anderson, Bruford, Wakeman, Howe & Levin Madison Square Garden, NYC 23 March 1990 Last night of the tour CD1/Set1 1. Intro 2. Time And A Word / Owner Of A Lonely Heart / Teakbois 3. Clap 4. Mood For A Day 5. Wakeman Solo 6. Long Distance Runaround / Bruford Solo 7. Birthright 8. And You And I 9. Themes 10. Levin / Bruford Duet CD2/Set2 1. Close To The Edge 2. The Meeting 3. Brother Of Mine 4. Heart Of The Sunrise 5. Order Of The Universe CD3 1. E1: Roundabout 2. Starship Trooper 3. E2: Sweet Dreams Taped by Kevin & Steve Hall Sony WM-D6C Professional Walkman recorder 2 Beyer M-700 microphones Maxell metal cassettes Mastered and FLAC'ed by Carl Morstadt (dantalion8@yahoo.com) Master Cassettes -> Aiwa AD-WX808 cassette deck -> M-Audio Firewire Audiophile 2496 -> CDWAV 24-bit/96-KHz wav files -> Goldwave (normalizing and crossfades) -> CD Wave (track breaks) dBpowerAMP Audio Converter (24-bit/96-KHz wav files converted to 16-bit/44.1 KHz wav files) -> FLAC Front End (FLAC 8 with sector boundary alignment) FLAC files tagged with Foobar2000 No EQ'ing. items.subject: old MSDOS game
items.description: Sierra On-Line, Inc. Published by Sierra On-Line, Inc. Developed by Game Arts Co., Ltd. Released 1990 Also For PC-88, Sharp X1 Genre Action, Role-Playing (RPG) Perspective Side view Visual 2D scrolling Art Anime / manga Gameplay Metroidvania, Platform Setting Fantasy Description The ancient demon Jashiin has slept for two thousand years. When he awakens, he directs his wrath towards the kingdom of Zeliard, whose rulers of yore have allegedly harmed him. For 115 days, a sand rain devastates the kingdom, turning it into a desert. To complete his cruel revenge, Jashiin turns Felicia, the princess of Zeliard, into a stone. The valiant Duke Garland sets out on a quest to vanquish the demon and restore the princess to her true form. To do that, he must collect the Nine Tears of Esmesanti, which alone can reverse the terrible curse. Zeliard is a side-scrolling action game with platforming and role-playing elements. The game world is divided into hostile labyrinths, which occupy its largest portion and contain maze-like passages for Duke Garland to traverse, as well as enemies that must be dealt with. Crests and keys must often be collected in order to ensure the progress to the next area. Garland takes damage from enemy attacks as well as the environment (hidden spikes, high temperature, etc.), but suffers no damage should he fall off a platform. The hero uses his sword to combat the enemies, and shield to defend himself. He can also learn and cast projectile offensive magic. Special items can restore his health, increase the damage inflicted with the sword, grant additional protection, etc. Various types of clothes can be equipped; these can bestow the hero with further enhancements and immunities, such as prevent him from slipping on ice, allow him to jump higher, etc. The Duke will visit different towns during his journey. In these towns, he can rest, replenishing his health, purchase and repair weapons and armor, acquire potions, and learn magic spells. Currency is obtained by exchanging enemy spirits for gold in banks. These spirits (called "almas") also serve as experience points: after the player has obtained a sufficient amount of them, the protagonist receives upgrades to his health and magic points from a local town sage. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry
items.title: ZELIARD

subject: home taping
experimental
items.description: this tape pairs two voice only experiments. pow3 was a three layer vocal work that i did after coming back from seeing powasaksi for the first time at the vogue theater. i remember chanting the theme the whole way back to the Grandbrother pad and then obsessively and compulsively laying down this madness. the two mikes were in my lap and i was running my head back and forth violently to achieve the stereo effects. it was a buzz just to do the whole thing which of course i did in one sitting. this was originally a c-30 as was bonus km to twitty city, but I've combined them onto one tape for listening easy. km is my travelogue on a road trip in my 1980 Pontiac 6000 ste  to Memphis. the twitty city reference is to one of the attractions around Nashville - dollywood, loretta lynn’s dude ranch, twitty city, etc. for conway twitty country music star. the highlight of the trip is to see the dairy truck with “la vache qui rit” logo on it. this was the name of a dfw comp which I’ve long loved but never officially translated, and there is was on a truck driving by me. i made these audio letters for different people who i wrote overseas to give an idea what it was like to travel on the American interstate system. so they are very explanational, and chatty. came home after biking back from the vogue after seeing powaskatsi and, at the Grandbrother pad sat in a chair and did 3 vocals from my memory of the movie. Finally got this one out of the main catalog. a large amount of this is on bonus km to twitty city vs pow 3., whew!
items.title: Unatoba - Bonus KM To Twitty City VS POW III

items.description: Zombi (1990)(Ubi Soft)(fr)[464 version] Released 1986 Published by Ubi Soft Entertainment Software Also For Amiga, Atari ST, Commodore 64, DOS, ZX Spectrum Genre Adventure Setting Sci-Fi / Futuristic Interface Multiple Units/Characters Control, Point and Select Gameplay Puzzle elements, Survival Horror Perspective 1st-person Description In Zombi you control a team of four intrepid travelers, who have landed their helicopter on the roof of a shopping centre in the hope of finding fuel. The problem is that, with Hell full, Zombies are walking the earth, devouring humans as they please. Zombi is a point and click adventure game in which you control the four characters (Alexandre, Sylvie, Yannick and Patrick) in turn, taking each of them individually through the abandoned complex. Lots of potentially-useful items have been left behind, some stored in cupboards - work out what they could be used for. Try to find a weapon with which to attack the zombies - bare-hands fighting only works for a few attempts before your character is worn out. Dead zombies should be placed in the freezer in the basement to stop them re-emerging. You have free rein over the shopping mall, and can use the bed shops to rest and the food shops for nourishment. Be wary of the dark and zombie-filled basement though. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry
items.title: Zombi (1990)(Ubi Soft)(fr)[464 version]

items.description: Título: A Bela Adormecida Título original: Sleeping Beauty Ano: 1959 Data de lançamento em VHS: 21/08/1990 (Brasil) Formato: VHS Coleção: Um Clássico de Walt Disney; Video Collection Walt Disney Distribuidora: Abril Vídeo; Walt Disney Home Video; Buena Vista Film Distribution Co., Inc. Estúdio: Walt Disney Productions Duração: 75 minutos Cor: Colorido Programação: Livre Versão: Dublado Enredo: Num reino distante e feliz, nasce a Princesa Aurora. No dia do seu batizado, ela é enfeitiçada pela Rainha do Reino do Mal e condenada a dormir cem anos. Nem as fadas conseguem proteger a pobre princesa. E agora, só o amor poderá salvá-la. Realizada sob a supervisão pessoal de Walt Disney, A Bela Adormecida é um grande clássico do desenho animado. Uma das mais emocionantes histórias de todos os tempos, embalada pela inesquecível música de Tchaikovsky. Para ver e rever sempre.
items.title: A Bela Adormecida (1959) (VHS Abril Vídeo; 1990)

items.description: Since the Middle Ages, lexographies of Talmudic and other rabbinic literature have combined in one entry Babylonian, Palestinian, and Targumic words from various periods. Because morphologically identical words in even closely related dialects can frequently differ in both meaning and nuance, their consolidation into one dictionary entry is often misleading. Scholars now realize the need to treat each dialect separately, and in A Dictionary of Jewish Palestinian Aramaic, Michael Sokoloff provides a complete lexicon of the dialect spoken and written by Jews in Palestine during the Byzantine period, from the third century C.E. to the tenth century. Sokoloff draws on a wide range of sources, from inscriptions discovered in the remains of synagogues and on amulets, fragments of letters and other documents, poems, and marginal notations to local Targumim, the Palestinian Midrashim and Talmud, texts addressing religious law (halacha), and Palestinian marriage documents (ketubbot) from the Arabic period. Many of these sources were unavailable to previous lexographers, who based their dictionaries on corrupt nineteenth-century editions of the rabbinic literature. The discovery of new manuscripts in both European libraries and the Cairo Geniza over the course of the twentieth century has revolutionized the textual basis of Jewish Palestinian Aramaic. Each entry in A Dictionary of Jewish Palestinian Aramaic is divided into six lemma or root, part of speech, English gloss, etymology, semantic features, and bibliographic references. Sokoloff also includes an index of all cited passages. This major reference work, updated to reflect the publication of new texts over the last decade, will both provide students and scholars with a tool for an accurate understanding of the Aramaic dialect of Jewish Palestinian literature of the Byzantine period and help Aramaist and Semitic linguists to see the relationship between this dialect and others, especially the contemporary dialects of Palestine. Publisher ‏ : ‎  Bar Ilan University Press; 2nd printing edition (January 1, 1990) Language ‏ : ‎  English Hardcover ‏ : ‎  823 pages ISBN-10 ‏ : ‎  9652261017 ISBN-13 ‏ : ‎  978-9652261014
items.title: A Dictionary of Jewish Palestinian Aramaic of the Byzantine period (Dictionaries of Talmud, Midrash, and Targum)

subject: Family Movie

items.description: The premise was that four cute upper-middle-class kids had been suddenly orphaned. About to be split up and sent to foster homes, they located a cranky old homeless man and offered him food, a home, and a decent life-style if he would live in their nice house and pose as their grandfather (this could only happen in a sitcom!). Of course he took his new responsibilities more seriously than they expected, and amid the quips, little lessons in life were learned by all around the sunny kitchen table. Roger was the helpful next-door neighbor, an air traffic controller turned homemaker.--IMDb (TiffBanks) IMCb User Review: 20 November 2009 / Jazzie-too / A Tender Robert Mitchum: I'm a fan of every Robert Mitchum movie. And then this TV series came along and he played this sentimental role as homeless man, who finds a place in a family of 3 children, without parents, each needing the other to sustain their independence and for the children to not be separated into foster care. I found it to be less comedy and more on family values. Heart-warming situations every week for about the 6 episodes that it ran. I was sad when it ended. But a couple of years ago I searched the web and found a commercial source for the DVD of the entire TV series. Robert Mitchum was so under appreciated for his natural talent. If you look at the body of his work, he could play any type of role. My favorite was "El Dorado". "Promises to Keep" was a TV movie that showed his softer side. And, yes, he played too many "B" movies. But he didn't care. He liked not being poor and making, as he called it, "easy money". Did you know he even wrote the story, acted the lead in the movie, and recorded the song "Thunder Road"? What a guy!!!
items.title: A-Family-For-Joe (1990 *****)

items.description: Hirakawa began work on it, he intended to write a handbook for students interested in the development of Buddhism across Asia that would serve as a useful guide to the basic issues in Buddhist doctrine, history, and bibliography.  Although the project soon became much longer and had a narrower focus than he had originally planned, it benefited in at least two ways from Hirakawa's original intention.  First, it is an exceptionally comprehensive discussion of Indian Buddhism, treating its history, doctrine, and bibliography with an admirable degree of completeness. Most of the significant topics in Indian Buddhism are discussed in some detail.  Second, it ·is a very clearly written text. Because Hirakawa wrote it with students as the intended audience, he composed it in a style that could be readily understood by students and informed general readers.
items.title: A History of Indian Buddhism

items.subject: mom
items.description: The story revolves around 11-year-old Jessica Slocum ( Juliet Sorci ), whose mother died when she was three years old. Her father, Jim ( Doug Sheehan ), is a workaholic with little time for his daughter and hasn't been able to spend time with her since her mother's death 8 years prior and still seems to be mourning her. Just before the Christmas holiday season, Jessica wins a free wish from a wishing well. Her wish for a mother for Christmas is granted by Philomena ( Doris Roberts ) and Amy Miller ( Olivia Newton-John ), a department store mannequin, is brought to life to be a mom for Jessica. However, there is a catch and Amy can only be a mother to her until Christmas Eve. To clear up any confusion for Jim, Amy claims herself to be a nanny from Australia hired to help care for Jessica while he's at work and she is given a spare room on top of the garage. Amy and Jessica get along until they suffer a brief misunderstanding. Jessica briefly wants to take back the wish and sees Amy go lifeless from her bedroom window. Horrified, she runs out in the rain and stairs to Amy's room, frantically knocking on her door. Amy opens up and Jessica is relieved to see her fine as she is ushered in. The next day, Jessica visits Philomena at the department store to see if she could take back the original wish. She wants Amy to stay forever with them because her father has grown fond of her and she can't bear to lose another mother. Philomena wishes she could help alter the wish, but shows Jessica what Amy will be up against if she isn't there to save her and other the mannequins with faces. The store she works at is planning to replace all the mannequins with faceless ones. Philomena tells Jessica there is only one way to avoid this and if she really wants to save Amy, they must act fast and join hands with her. That isn't the only thing Amy is up against, an inquisitive store detective suspects her of taking a missing Santa mannequin (needed for Jessica's Christmas pageant) from the store and questions her. However, Amy's mannequin friends come to her aid, especially a male mannequin dressed as a driver who warns him to keep his distance from her. Amy and the Santa mannequin both help Jessica overcome her stage fright and put on a convincing performance that wow's the crowd. Jim takes a photograph of Jessica, his first picture of her since her mother died. Christmas Eve and Philomena is late to perform the ritual needed to save Amy so she has to return to the store. Jessica recruits Jim to help save her and they head to the store. By the time they reach the store, they see Amy having gone back to being a mannequin and Jessica throws herself at her. She begs her father to grab Amy's hand and he reluctantly does. The ritual works and Amy is brought back before them. They head for home and Amy's mannequin friends wishes her the best of luck in her new life, while the store detective is awakened by Philomena using her magic feather duster. The film ends with a Christmas picture of Jim, Amy and Jessica.
items.title: A Mom For Xmas

items.subject: Emulation for PC
items.description: LJN's NES version of the classic horror series casts the player as a teen searching the houses on Elm Street for Freddy Krueger's bones. Once they are all collected, they must be thrown into the high school furnace to destroy Freddy once and for all (a plot similar to 1987's A Nightmare on Elm Street 3: Dream Warriors). Nightmare has two worlds. In the red-tinted "real world," players fight snakes and spiders while navigating standard platform challenges. The players here have a "sleep meter" that depletes with every hit taken. If the player's sleep meter drops to empty, the game transitions into the blue-tinted "dream world," where enemies take on the appearance of skeletons and ghosts. An invisible timer also starts, counting down until Freddy appears and forces the player into a brief boss battle. The sleep meter becomes a standard life gauge in the dream world, and deducts a life from the player if drained. Players can find and collect three different icons in the dream world to become "Dream Warriors" with special powers and projectile attacks - both of which give a significant edge when fighting Freddy. Collecting all the bones in a level takes the player to a final level boss, usually taking the form of a monster with Freddy's face or trademark razor glove. Players move back and forth down Elm Street, and a new house opens up as the previous one is cleared. Nightmare is compatible with the NES Four Score accessory, allowing up to four players to play at once using the same screen.
items.title: A Nightmare on Elm Street

A similar version with fewer disk-testing routines was available for the Apple IIc.

subject: edutainment
Dante's Inferno
items.description: You are a famous crimebuster hot on the trail of that world-renowned thief, Carmen Santiago, and her latest gang. The rumours that she had died in a bizarre accident don't deter you; after all, it might just be misdirection. So you track her to the Dark Woods of I/O Error, where you encounter three hideous beasts and lose your way in the night. Virgil, a Greek poet, meets you in your frenzy and tells you that the only way out is through Hell itself. "Alas," he continues, "the geography of Hell has changed since last I guided a mortal through it, and you will need assistance besides mine to get through the frozen caves of Cocytus to Paradise." "Who might this assistance come from?" you wonder aloud. "Why, from the latest arrival to the Inferno," your guide informs you. "Carmen Santiago." Oh well. You've tracked Carmen around the world; through Europe, America, and the reaches of Time. Surely the afterlife won't be much harder! In WHERE IN HELL IS CARMEN SANTIAGO?, you will need to use your detective skills and knowledge of facts from Canticle One of Dante's Commedia: "Inferno". Her gang members are here, too, and they bear the punishment that they earned in their lives. Besides that, they bear information on their fellows, as well as useful items to help you in your quest. By talking to them and interpreting their dossiers, you'll figure out where the others are and what items they most desire. Beware! You have only a limited amount of time to find Carmen-- and if you try to find her in the wrong area, you'll be damned for eternity! ( Read the full manual .)
items.title: Where in Hell is Carmen Santiago

items.description: Alfa Boot (demo) (199x)(StanBit)(PL)[k-file] Platform Atari 8-bit Released 1994 Published by StanBit Perspective 1st-person Interface Point and Select Genre Adventure Visual Fixed / Flip-screen Description Alfa-Boot is an adventure game with a point-and-click interface; the protagonist is a special agent, sent out to stop a radioactive leak in a nuclear submarine down in the ocean. The game uses a simple interface where the player can move a cursor around to select an object in the first-person-view image of the location he's in, and interact with this object in a number of ways. Many objects can be examined, with their descriptions appearing at the bottom of the screen. There is also an ever-present "go" option which allows the player to follow any exit out of the room, including those not visible on screen. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry
items.title: Alfa Boot (demo)

items.description: Amulet, The (1990-04-01)(Tiara Software)(GB)
items.title: The Amulet

items.subject: ATRUtil k-file disks
items.description: Arcade Fruit Machine (1990)(Zeppelin Games)(GB)[cr Burton Bandit][a][k-file] Developed by Zeppelin Games Limited Released 1990 Also For Amiga, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, Commodore 64, DOS, ZX Spectrum Published by Zeppelin Games Limited Gameplay Casino / Gambling Genre Simulation Description Simulation of slot machine. Player throws several coins in the slot and begins his career. During the improvement of his skill player completes CASH'n'GRAB feature, where he must collect numbers chosen during gambling to complete all letters. Completing this feature, player is allowed to choose one from three bonuses (Pick a Win, Fruit Step, Win Spins) or three misses (Skill Stop, Cash Pot, Hudge Pot). Also he tries to complete CASH RUN feature. During every steps of gambling player can cancel gambling or collect feature. Finishing the career player updates his bank (in UK pounds). From Mobygames.com. Original Entry
items.title: Arcade Fruit Machine [cr Burton Bandit][a]

items.description: Blinky's Scary School (1990)(Zeppelin Games)(GB)(PAL)[cr Mr. Bacardi] Developed by Zeppelin Games Limited Released 1990 Also For Amiga, Atari ST, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum Published by Zeppelin Games Limited Perspective Side view Genre Action Gameplay Platform Visual Fixed / Flip-screen Description The first of Blinky the ghost's two outings, the ghost with the most has to progress through a series of levels and remove the hazards left by ghost-busters (who aren't called Peter, Egon, Winston or Ray for licensing reasons). He does this by collecting the right objects to cast the all important spells. The levels themselves are flick-screen and are layered with platforms. Making the task difficult are spiders, mice and the like - watch out in particular for the jumping frogs. Once the appropriate spells have been cast (involving lots of back-tracking to collect objects and bring them to the cauldron) the objects to make an underwater diving suit must be obtained. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry
items.title: Blinky's Scary School (PAL)[cr Mr. Bacardi]

items.description: Caveman (199x)(Mirage)(PL)[k-file] Developed by Taurus Software Released 1993 Platform Atari 8-bit Published by Mirage Software Perspective Side view Setting Prehistoric Genre Action Gameplay Platform Visual Fixed / Flip-screen Description Caveman is a platform game set in the prehistoric times, similar to Prehistorik . As a caveman, on each level the player has to find food for his family. The main protagonist wanders around the wilderness and explores caves in his search. Hostile animals and plants have to be avoided - contact with them drains health. There are also dangerous environment elements such as bonfires or deep water. There is a time limit on each level, and a specific amount of food to be collected before the level can be completed. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry
items.title: Caveman

items.description: Cavernia (1990)(Zeppelin Games)(GB) Platform Atari 8-bit Released 1990 Published by Zeppelin Games Limited Perspective Side view Genre Action Gameplay Platform Visual 2D scrolling Description Cavernia is a platform game, set in a cave. As Teddy Arklethorpe, the player has to complete sixteen levels; finishing each level requires Teddy to collect all the treasures scattered throughout, then grabbing the key and getting to the exit. The gameplay is typical for the genre, with leaping across gaps, riding on moving platforms and leaping up to grab ledges. Monsters such as ghosts and mutants, and dangerous environment such as spikes and falling stalactites await throughout; contact with them means losing a life. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry
items.title: Cavernia

items.description: Convicts, The (1990)(Domain Software)(PL) Platform Atari 8-bit Released 1992 Published by Domain Software Gameplay Arcade Genre Action Description The Convicts is a labyrinth game. The game offers fun for two players on a split screen mode. In a galaxy far away lived creatures called Snows. They held the Power Gem. The Lord of the Non-existence called Akron attacked the planet. The crystal shattered into thousands of pieces. Invasion survived two Snows. Their mission is to collect all the shards scattered around the maze of traps and restoration of life on the planet. The task will interfere with moving walls, shooting cannons, missiles, teleporters and hordes of monsters. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry
items.title: The Convicts

items.description: Inside (1990)(Spektra)(PL)[cr Madmax CS] Platform Atari 8-bit Released 1990 Published by Spektra Perspective 3rd-person (Other), Side view Genre Action Setting Sci-Fi / Futuristic Description Inside is a side-scrolling action game for up to two players, based on the C64 game Chip-War . The player controls a ship placed inside the computer (on the main board) who has to repair all eight chips needed to supply the power to the computer. After finding the broken chip the player is transferred to the diagram board. The player must replace the damaged parts before time runs out. At any time the player can check the amount of remaining errors (T letter) or view the correct schema (S letter, costs 100 time units). Not repaired components results in loss of computer power. All damages affect the game itself, for example, damaged sound card distorts the music, damaged graphics card blurs the screen view, damaged joystick port interacts with steering the ship. Reaching the zero power level turns off the computer and ends the game. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry
items.title: Inside [cr Madmax CS]

items.description: Kolony (1990)(Mirage)(PL) Developed by Nemezys Software Group Released 1991 Also For Commodore 64 Published by Mirage Software Pacing Turn-based Genre Strategy/Tactics Setting Sci-Fi / Futuristic Gameplay Managerial / Business Simulation Perspective Text-based / Spreadsheet Interface Menu Structures Description Kolony is a turn-based strategy game, putting the player in the position of a governor of a colony on a distant planet. The goal of the game is to accumulate 100 million of currency within 10 years. The game is divided into turns, with each turn representing a single month. Main source of money is excavating and selling natural resources (silicon, iron, uranium, food) to merchant ships which arrive every few turns. In order to excavate a resource, the player must first send expeditions of colonists and scientists until a mine is found. Excavating a resource requires the presence of miner robots, human colonists to direct them, and electricity. Electric power is created by generators, which use up some uranium each turn. Building new structures (warehouses, residences for the staff, factories, landing sites for merchant ships) requires spending resources, and takes some electric power too. Once a factory is constructed, the player can produce machines such as robots and generators, though this requires staff, time and electric power as well. Food is gathered from fields; the more colonists are assigned to the fields, the more food is harvested every six months. New staff can be recruited from arriving merchant ships. The players (if there is more than one) can attack each other, but have to build up an army first, consisting of starfighters, battle robots and soldiers. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry
items.title: Kolony

items.description: Lasermania (1990)(L.K. Avalon)(PL) Platform Atari 8-bit Released 1990 Published by L.K. Avalon Perspective Top-down Genre Compilation, Puzzle Visual Fixed / Flip-screen Description This compilation includes the following titles: Lasermania is a puzzle game. The aim is to destroy all the alarm system sensors by means of a laser beam and collect sets of storage. The direction of the laser beam can be changed by moving polished steel elements. Players must be wary of the laser switches which detonate ray generator. After clearing the room must accompany the vehicle to lock. The game includes over 50 levels. Robbo Konstruktor is a planets editor to the game Robbo . From Mobygames.com. Original Entry
items.title: Lasermania

items.description: Miss Mind - Ania (1990)(Janusz Bien)(PL)[h Skaja Soft] Developed by Nemesis Software Released 1990 Also For Commodore 64 Gameplay Board Game Genre Puzzle Description Miss Mind II: Ania is a puzzle-board game. The player's task is to guess the sequence of five digits in six attempts. At the top of the screen the player indicates digits from 0 to 9. The results of the trials are shown on the top right side of the screen: full dot (C64 - hearts) is a perfect match, half full dot (C64 - question mark) means that the digit occurs in a different place. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry

items.description: Mozgprocesor v1.0C (1990)(Computer Adventure Studio)(PL) Developed by Computer Adventure Studio Released 1990 Also For ZX Spectrum Published by Computer Adventure Studio Gameplay Interactive Fiction / Text Adventure Genre Adventure Setting Sci-Fi / Futuristic Description Mózg Procesor is an illustrated text adventure taking place in 2016. The story is set on an island where player's character is on the mission to find the brain processor that can rescue a genius academic Brian Thompson. Professor, creator of a biological computer, suffered an accident on the way to the conference, which was planning to present his invention. The only hope of saving the scientist is to implant him the brain processor. If the player fails to deliver the brain processor on time, the game is lost. The player is a highly skilled ONZ agent who has four hours to infiltrate the island, equipped with a clock with compass and Geiger counter. The agent can also use the map of the island. Text in the game is supplemented by graphics, sound and the ticking clock that tells the player when his mission need to be completed. Radiation meter indicate the levels of radioactivity that could affect the mission's success. Additional difficulties are: limited number of the conveyed items, fatigue, and the need to use tools in specific actions. The player performs activities using text commands. Around 40 commands were implemented with different word variations. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry
items.title: Mozgprocesor v1.0C

items.description: Najemnik - Powrot (199x)(Krysal Software)(PL)[k-file] Developed by Laboratorium Komputerowe APM Released 1993 Also For Commodore 64 Published by Krysal Sp. z o.o. Perspective 1st-person Genre Action Gameplay Rail Shooter, Shooter Description Najemnik - Powrót is a is a first-person shooter. Player takes a role of mercenary. Before each mission the player can visit weaponry shop, shooting gallery and casino. For the execution of each mission mercenary receives payment. Player may spend earned money in the casino or in the weaponry shop .The store offers bulletproof vest and five weapons: COLT pistol, shotgun, Uzi machine gun, rocket launcher and grenades. To be admitted to each mission the player must pass the exam at the shooting range. The game takes place on a single board. Mercenary task is to track down and kill the enemies without losing all energy. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry
items.title: Najemnik: Powrot

items.subject: ATRUtil k-file disks
items.description: Nuclear Adventure or the North Base (1990)(JRC)(CZ)[k-file] Developed by Ropasoft Released 1990 Platform Atari 8-bit Published by JRC Interactive Perspective Side view Narrative Spy / Espionage Genre Action, Adventure Gameplay Shooter Description The player controls a Soviet agent who infiltrated an American base and tries to destroy it. His task is to turn on a destruction system of the rockets in the base. To fulfill it he has to find the launching terminal. The task is not that easy as the base is a big labyrinth full of American soldiers. Enemies can be killed by shooting. Ammo can be bought in a shop but player can't spend much. There is a terminal in every room. It can be used to make contact with some people to gain information. Player has to get their number before contacting them. Some institutions or people can be contacted through a phone that player has to find. There are also characters that can be contacted only through Ministry of Defence terminal. In the end he has to find the Rocket launching terminal and hack it. Then he has to escape. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry
items.title: Nuclear Adventure or the North Base

items.description: Plastron (1990)(Harlequin Software)(GB) Platform Atari 8-bit Released 1990 Published by Harlequin Software Ltd. Perspective Side view Genre Action Setting Sci-Fi / Futuristic Description Planet Plastron is the last remaining source of fossil fuels. As Omni-Corp has been mining it exclusively for 500 years, they have excessive commercial power. To limit this, you head to the planet in the Scavenger One craft, collecting as much fuel as possible. Gameplay is essentially Moon Patrol with a third movement dimension (steering the craft, moving it up or down the side-viewed screen). The surface is rocky and full of craters - falling into these damages the craft. There are gaps in the road, some preceded by ramps. Your craft can jump - you start with a limited amount but more can be collected alongside the fuel tokens. Some sections have enemy craft, either patrolling the ground or shooting at you from overhead. Each section must be completed within a time limit. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry
items.title: Plastron

items.subject: ATRUtil k-file disks
items.description: Plot (1990)(KE-Soft)(DE)(en)[k-file] Platform Atari 8-bit Released 1990 Published by KE-Soft Pacing Real-Time Genre Puzzle Gameplay Tile Matching Puzzle Perspective Side view Visual Fixed / Flip-screen Interface Direct Control Description In Plot you take the part of a round head, with curly golden locks cropped close to the scalp, in a cell that has a penchant for matching symbols on tiles. Your red head will move vertically on the right side of the cell while holding a tile to you left. This tile will show a symbol on it. The symbol will match with tiles on the other side of the cell. Your goal is to shove the tile across the room and match it with tiles that share its symbol. Once you destroy a tile you'll receive a new tile, more specifically, a tile that matches one near or behind the one(s) you destroyed You can attack the tiles directly from the right or ricochet them off an angle in the ceiling. Another devious trick up your sleeve is the lightning tile. This tile with its lightning design can mimic any other. If it touches another tile it will act as if the correct image has touched it and booth shall explode. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry
items.title: Plot

items.description: Ruff and Reddy (1990)(Hi-Tec Software)(GB)[cr KSL][k-file] Developed by PAL Developments Released 1990 Also For Amiga, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum Published by Hi-Tec Software Ltd. Gameplay Platform Genre Action Misc Licensed Description Due to an accident involving Professor Flipnoodles' Pocket Rocket (would you trust a scientist called Flipnoodles? I certainly wouldn't, especially as mad scientists cause so many computer game plot disasters) the Hanna Barbera characters have been hurtled into space. The Lilli-Punies have kidnapped them, and will only let them free if they can rescue their missing compatriots. The search starts on the surface of the planet, but also takes Ruff underground into the cavernous regions the Lilli-Punies live in. These have lots of water, which Ruff must avoid. Plenty of extra lives can be collected along the way, with solving puzzles as important as good reactions and dexterity. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry

items.description: World Soccer (1990)(Zeppelin Games)(GB) Developed by Zeppelin Games Limited Released 1990 Also For Amiga, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum Published by Zeppelin Games Limited Gameplay Managerial / Business Simulation Genre Simulation, Sports Sport Football (European) / Soccer Description World Soccer is a managerial soccer simulation in which the player is responsible for the financial and athletic success of a soccer team. The world soccer league is the home of the best teams of Europe and the player takes over a team from the 3rd division; the goal being to become the number one in the long run. The game is mostly menu based in which the player can visit the medical station, the transfer market (available athletes are searched by a scout), the bank for a loan and of course the lineup for the next match. Each athlete has a few statistics which should be taken into account. During the matches the player can't intervene besides substitutions in the half-time. The player can watch the highlights of the match; either with animations in the 16-bit versions or as text in the 8-bit version. Alternatively only the results can be shown. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry
items.title: World Soccer

items.description: Yogi Bear and Friends in The Greed Monster (1990)(Hi-Tec Software)(GB)[cr Bloody Coders][k-file] Developed by PAL Developments Released 1990 Also For Amiga, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum Published by Hi-Tec Software Ltd. Misc Licensed Perspective Top-down Genre Action Gameplay Puzzle elements Visual Fixed / Flip-screen Description All the toys in the World have been stolen by the Greed Monster, so Top Cat has sent Yogi's Treasure Hunters to find them all. Problem is, all the hunters have been captured by the monster except Yogi, so it's up to Yogi to find his friends and all the toys. The game is a flick-screen maze game viewed from a high elevated angle as you control Yogi. You have to search the surrounding areas looking for your friends and toys while avoiding or shooting various creatures. You are armed with sweets to shoot the creatures but these are limited. If you are touched by a creature or certain obstacles then you lose part of a food gauge and when this is empty then it is game over. As well as the toys and your friends, there are other items that can be collected and they are coloured keys to open the same coloured door, cans of pop to double your speed, extra sweets and jars of honey to make you invincible for a limited period. Bubble gum needs avoiding as these will stick you to the spot for a limited time. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry
items.title: Yogi Bear and Friends in The Greed Monster [cr Bloody Coders]

items.description: Yogi's Great Escape (1990)(Hi-Tec Software)(PAL)(GB)[cr Prof-Soft][t +2 Prof-Soft] Developed by PAL Developments Released 1990 Also For Amiga, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum Published by Hi-Tec Software Ltd. Gameplay Platform Genre Action Misc Licensed Description Yogi Bear has woken from his hibernation and is now searching his home, Jellystone Park for Picnic Baskets brought by tourists. On one search, Yogi over hears an awful telephone conversation with Ranger Smith that the Park is closing and all animals must be caught and transferred to a zoo. Not wanting to live in a cage or enclosure, Yogi has decided to escape and thus the beginning of his adventure. You have to guide Yogi over six levels (ending in New York) keeping ahead of a tracker and his dog. You must complete each level in 2 minutes 40 seconds or it is game over. On the way there are obstacles like holes and water, as well as other characters to get in your way. Touching these loses one of three lives. Scattered over the levels are various food items which will give you 100 points as well as invisible ones giving 250 points. If you want a bigger score then on certain levels you can collect six items which reward you with 7500 points. Yogi's Great Escape is a platform game where you move Yogi from left to right with the screen scrolling when you move. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry
items.title: Yogi's Great Escape (PAL)[cr Prof-Soft][t +2 Prof-Soft]

items.description: Zbir (199x)(Mirage)(PL)[a][k-file] Platform Atari 8-bit Released 1993 Published by Mirage Software Perspective Side view Setting Fantasy Genre Action Gameplay Arcade, Platform Visual Fixed / Flip-screen Description Zbir is a platform game. The action takes place in a Malaskara river basin, in a land called Krugundia. The player is a common thug, who turned out to be a forgotten prince. To regain the player must traverse the castle of evil sorcerer to find three symbols of authority: crown, scepter and golden apple. Some locked places are available after finding the appropriate items. The castle is inhabited by randomly appearing hostile beings, such as phantoms, mutants, spiders or ghosts. The contract with them means a loss of life. The creatures may be killed by a short sword or over jumped. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry

items.description: Zero War (1990)(Harlequin Software)(GB)[cr Burton Bandit][h Bloody Coders][k-file] Platform Atari 8-bit Released 1990 Published by Harlequin Software Ltd. Perspective Side view Genre Action Setting Sci-Fi / Futuristic Gameplay Arcade, Shooter Description Zero Wars is a side-scrolling science fiction shooter. The game takes place inside a space station invaded by alien forms. As a space fighter pilot the player must destroy all the hostile aliens. The player uses gun sight to target enemies. After clearing corridor a container appears. Shooting container gives an extra object, such us: smart bomb, crystal, shield, rapid fire weapon. Missing container causes re-appearing aliens in this corridor. Achieving the next level requires collecting of three crystals. After each completed sector player receives a level password. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry

items.subject: Dayo Wong, 黃子華
items.description: 《娛樂圈血肉史》(1990) － 開創港產楝篤笑的先河，黃子華以自身經歷做話題已夠娛樂性，一口氣定神閒講二小時亦殊不簡單。 黃子華棟篤笑系列的第一輯 1990年8月30日，於香港文化中心劇場演出，共1場 1990年10月於香港文化中心加開3場 1991年6月重演，以尹光〈關人隱士〉為片尾曲 黃子華自1984年從加拿大畢業回港後，一心希望成為演員，惟當時的無線電視藝員訓練班突然取消(至1987年復辦)，只有編劇訓練班，黃子華希望能夠藉著成為編劇在電視城工作，往後再轉職為演員。後來他發現編劇難以轉型成為演員後，輾轉加入了香港話劇團，之後成為商業電台唱片騎師，期間參與演出過香港電台電視節目《特寫青春》、《性本善》(兼任編劇)等等，隨後參加1987年無線電視舉辦的「全能司儀選拔大賽」。 兩年後同鄧梓峰和洪朝豐擔任亞洲電視清談節目《晨早直播室》的主持。黃子華在電視訪談節目《志雲飯局》中形容，這段時間為其人生的低潮。 1990年，黃子華決定將其自己在娛樂圈的經歷以棟篤笑表述，並且決定從此不再在娛樂圈工作。然而，其棟篤笑演出大受歡迎，深入民心，並且開始成名，最後他放棄了離開娛樂圈的念頭。 為何我會做棟篤笑(自序) 原載於1990年出版的《娛樂圈血肉史》同名劇本 以下是我做這次棟篤笑(STAND-UP COMEDY)的原因(排名不分時間及重要性): (1) 一個朋友忽然患了腎病。 (2) 時常失眠。 (3) 做了一個不是喜劇的個人表演，卻引來不少笑聲，邵國華對我說：「你應該做STAND-UP COMEDY，因為你夠賤。」 (4) 下班後不想回家，回家之後不想再上班。 (5) 「搞笑SHOW」流行起來。 (6) 葉潔馨：「你應該做STAND-UP COMEDY。」 (7) 讀了SPALDLING GRAY的邊緣棟篤笑SWIMMING TO COMBODIA。他不講別人，只講自己，不大好笑。 (8) 看EDDIE MURPHY的棟篤笑DELIRIOUS，好好笑。 (9) 迷惘。書也不想看。 (10) 儲蓄了很久的小量金錢一下子又被借光。 (11) 看見許冠文在Sam的演唱會中做棟篤笑。 (12) 太寂寞，養了一隻狗。 (13) 快三十了。 *能夠代我把上列事項依時間及重要性重新排列者，可獲鄙人是次棟篤笑錄音帶一盒。
items.title: 黃子華棟篤笑 娛樂圈血肉史 (1990)

items.description: This is the very first release in the Auricular Audio Magazine series - repleat in its low-fi-ness. It was mid 1990 and San Francisco was an odd place for experimental music. Whether it was free jazz, noise, or ambient, the artists all huddled together, played together and shared their music with one another. It would not be unusual in one night to see four bands perform that shared variations of many of the members across them. This first release captures performances by 4 groups that oddly enough performed alot of shows together during this time. The Molecules, fronted(?) by Ron Anderson, who had recently relocated from NYC, were starting to infect the Bay Area with the chaos only they knew best. These particular pieces featured Steve Buchanan, who at the time was visiting the Bay Area. At the same time Nux Vomica was a brand new group, and was comprised of only Alan Herrick. The sound was much different than what people are familiar with today. The piece recorded for this compilation also featured Jim Cribley of Chemical Toybox. Rounding out the release were experimental music veterans Big City Orchestre as well as a live performance by noize artists Haters
items.title: Auricular Audio Magazine #1

items.description: This paper develops a beam pattern design procedure for general multidimensional irregular sonar arrays that incorporates the not well understood effects of array geometry into the design process. The procedure is implemented by generating a penalty function in a spectral covariance function form. Processing the penalty function causes beam pattern high sidelobes to be penalized and the main lobe to be emphasized. This is accomplished by forming the penalty function in terms of an isotropic noise field of specified strength modified with a finite sector of low coherent energy and stabilized with incoherent sensor noise. By inputting the penalty function into a minimum variance beamformer, the beam pattern and aperture weights are calculated based on the given array geometry. The beamformer used is Capon's Maximum Likelihood Method. The array used to test the procedure is located on sixty degree sector of a cylindrical surface. The procedure is implemented by two different methods, each with some desirable characteristics. One method suppresses sidelobes indirectly by the enhancement of the main lobe with anti-nulls. Both methods are evaluated in terms of a sensitivity factor which constrains the maximum white noise array gain. (Author)
items.title: A beam pattern design procedure for multidimensional sonar arrays employing minimum variance beamforming

description: This compelling account of the two lovers who scandalized twelfth-century France takes us on an astounding journey into the relationship that gave rise to Abelard's unbridled lust and Heloise's legendary love. With stunning immediacy, the very personal and deeply moving narrative tells the events that shaped the lives of the celebrated philosopher and his sixteen-year-old pupil, herself no newcomer to scholarship. Young as she was, Heloise had gained distinction for her accomplishments long before Abelard sought her out and contrived to become her tutor. Their famous correspondence, which poignantly details their passions, began years after their marriage and forced separation, long after Heloise had been coerced into entering a convent and Abelard had become an ascetic monk. Though Abelard's academic brilliance left its mark on the centuries that followed, it is Heloise, her indomitable spirit and infinite compassion for the man she loved, who transcends the ages. [Back cover]
items.title: Abelard and Heloise : their lives, their love, their letters

items.description: This thesis project included a literature survey of biological and artificial neural network research followed by development and testing of high- order and image recognition hierarchical neural network algorithms. Following training, performance testing of second-order and third-order networks yielded maximum accuracies comparable to those achieved by multilayer perceptron classifiers operating on test data sets. Several versions of an image classification algorithm were tested for learning performance using pixel data from forward-looking infrared (FLIR) images of tanks, trucks, target boards, and clutter. Employing the biologically-motivated Lambertization and contrast normalization of pixel windows, correlations with multiple Gabor function wavelets, and a 'phase synchronizing' local averaging routine, the image classification network extracted data features. Different network versions fed the extracted features to varying output classification schemes. To improve separation of problem classes, recommendations were made for varying the parameters of the Gabor function wavelets and modifying the phase synchronization scheme to extract more suitable features from image pixel data.
items.title: A Biologically-Inspired Neural Network Architecture for Image Processing

subject: Space vehicles

Ablative
hypersonic
NASA
Mars
heat shield
items.description: A material that behaves likes a glassy ablator on the surface, has a low thermal conductivity, is structurally tough, lightweight, and is in some sense reusable, would be desirable for the protective heat shield used on Earth entry vehicles. A material for this purpose has been developed that uses silicon dioxide (fused quartz) in a fibrous packed matrix, forming blocks which can behave as a glassy ablator on the surface when subject to very high surface heat fluxes. These fibrous silicon dioxide blocks are called Reusable Surface Insulation (RSI). The primary constituent of the RSI material is silicon dioxide, but may contain other compounds (e.g. alumina borosilicate) to affect the thermal and physical properties. The research performed in this thesis is to determine the ablative behavior of ceramic RSI materials in a hypersonic high enthalpy flow that is used to simulate entry into Earth atmosphere. Actual arc jet experiments were performed to measure mass loss, melt run off, and fiber collapse of these materials and compare the experimental results with predicted theoretical values. The tests were performed to ascertain if RSI type materials could be used for entry vehicles proposed in NASA Mars missions.
items.title: Ablative heat shield studies for NASA Mars/Earth return entry vehicles

items.subject: Automobiles
description: Director, Mark Ruzzin; writer, Anne Richardson; director of photography, Jim Fealy
Ariel Sanchez, Chris Davis, and featuring The Choristers of the Cathedral of St. John the Divine (Cathedral School for Boys and Girls)

Playing hooky from school, Tony, a student/chorister at the Cathedral of St. John the Divine, spends the afternoon at Central Park's Sailboat lake and retrieves a remote control device left behind by a pair of sailboat racers. Back in the schoolyard, Tony pretends that he has a car to go with the remote control. When another boy tries to take the control from him, it falls on the ground and a red remote-control sports car miraculously appears. The car "dances" to rap music and even brings Tony a can of soda. One day, a sinister-looking man with a briefcase steals the car and flees into the subway. Tony and his classmates pursue the thief to the Wall Street area and ask to inspect the briefcases of passing businessmen. Eluding the students, the crook hails a taxi and hurls the briefcase from the window. Next morning, Tony hears the sound of a sports car during a church service. Returning to its rightful owner, the magical car mysteriously reappears at the end of the processional
items.title: A Boy and His Car

description: "For the Montana Natural Heritage Program, Bureau of Land Management - Billings Resource Area, Custer National Forest."

This report documents the results of a study of bat occurrence in the Pryor Mountains of south central Montana. The field research was conducted from 15 June to 10 September, 1989. Bats were captured in mist nets set over ponds, streams, and springs and at the entrance of two caves. Numbers of bats captured were greatest at Little Ice Cave and at Mystery Cave. Capture success was considerably lower at water sources, but a greater diversity of species were captured at these sites, particularly at Sage Creek campground and Gyp Spring. Most of the species captured occurred throughout the area, with the exception of the pallid bat, Antrozous pallidus, and the silver-haired bat, Lasionycteris noctivagans, which were more restricted in distribution. Eight individuals of Antrozous pallidus were captured at Gyp Spring. This species was known previously in Montana from only one specimen taken at Gyp spring (Shryer and Flath, 1980). Of the eight individual pallid bats netted in 1989, four were lactating females, indicating that this species breeds in Montana. Several of the species of bats found in the Pryor Mountains were captured in numbers significantly different from an expected 1:1 sex ration. This was especially true at Mystery Cave and Little Ice Cave, suggesting that in some species, male and females may be differentially utilizing habitat. Bat activity at both Mystery Cave and Little Ice Cave indicated that these caves provide important summer roosting habitat for bats. Additionally, both caves possess characteristics which may make them important as hibernacula
items.title: Abundance and distribution of bats in the Pryor Mountains of south central Montana

items.description: This thesis describes a CAD compatible circuit model for an inductive strip with finite metal thickness centered in finline with wb=1. Scattering coefficients predicted by the circuit model are in good agreement with those predicted by an electromagnetic model based on Maxwell's equations. Filter simulations using the circuit model predict responses which are in good agreement with laboratory measurements.

subject: Ebert-Fastie Spectrograph
ultraviolet spectra
dayglow
OII 2770 Î©A multiplet
OI 2972 Î©A line emission
items.description: The MUSTANG instrument was calibrated using standard techniques to determine the sensitivity and wavelength calibrations and field of view. The instrument was launched aboard a NASA sounding rocket on March 30, 1990. Post- flight tests indicated that the calibration did not change as a result of the rocket experiment. Ultraviolet dayglow spectra of the Earth's ionosphere were obtained from approximately 100 km to 320 km in altitude over a wavelength range of 1800 A to 3400 A. The spectra were divided into 512 pixels of approximately 3.134 A per pixel. Analyses of the data from 2420 A to 2490 A and from 2920 A to 2972 A were conducted to obtain the intensity profiles of the OII 2470.4 A multiplet and the OI 2972.3 A line emission, respectively. The intensity profile of the OII 2470.4 A multiplet was found to have a broad peak of 1.6 kR centered at approximately 250 km. The intensity profile of the OI 2972.3 A line emission shows a general trend of decreasing intensity with altitude. The maximum intensity of 3.6 kR was found at 105 km and the minimum of 137 R at 315 km. A partial layer, with an intensity of 4.1 kR, was evident near 150 km.
items.title: A calibration of the Naval Postgraduate School Middle Ultraviolet Spectrograph and an analysis of the OII 2470 Î©A and OI 2972 Î©A emissions obtained from mid-latitude rocket observations

subject: Natural language processing (Computer science)
Natural language processing
multimedia database system
natural language interface
descriptive captions
items.description: This research examined the grammar structure of descriptive English captions on multimedia data. The research was composed of three phases. The first phase was to investigate the grammar structure of example descriptive captions from a variety of subject domains. The second phase was to develop a set of domain independent binary grammar rules to be used in the Caption-Based Interface (CBI) which is a natural language interface for the Multimedia Database System. The third phase of the research was to implement and test the grammar rules in the CBI. The program was implemented in C-prolog on a Sun SPARC workstation. The testing phase also includes timing and memory comparisons between C-Prolog an interpretive programming language and a compiled version of the code using Quintus Prolog. This thesis was able to show that the grammar rules that were developed could correctly identify their intended structures. Another accomplishment of this thesis was to demonstrate that the CBI could parse 25 out of 30 example captions and that it could correctly handle some semantic interpretations of the parsed captions.
items.title: A caption-based natural-language interface handling descriptive captions for a multimedia database system

subject: Operations research
Modeling
Carrier
Optimization
Deployment Model
items.description: Aircraft carriers are and will continue to be highly important to the United States as she safeguards her interests globally. Today's budget environment, however, demands efficient use of these carrier assets in meeting their station coverage assignments. In a peacetime environment, a carrier's ability to cover a station is constrained by depot maintenance, training cycles, and the Chief of Naval Operations personnel and operating tempo program (PERSTEMPO OPTEMPO). To aid in satisfying this demand on carriers, a mixed integer programming model is developed. The output from the model provides optimal station coverage assignments for a given level of coverage under constraints associated with carrier operations. When implemented in conjunction with the General Algebraic Modeling System (GAMS), the model requires minimal user inputs and is implementable on a personal computer. Other applications of the model are also demonstrated in several examples.
items.title: A carrier deployment model
